channel.title: I2P is not working in whonix-workstation
channel.description:
I followed all instructions on this page 'https://www.whonix.org/wiki/I2P' but I could not able to get it running. I done all the steps and then waited for few hrs and checked the status as well. 'sudo systemctl status i2p' timer showing network is activated 30 min ago. I still cant access i2p websites through tor browser. Time out error and server not found error. I checked the iceweasel and I can see foxyproxy extension but not activated, in tor browser I cant see anything as such.
Is there anything else I suppose to do?

item.title: I2P is not working in whonix-workstation
item.dc:creator: anon36816226
item.description:
You can check ‘/var/log/i2p/wrapper.log’ to see if the I2P Router did start and succesfully build a tunnel.
But first you should read the Wikipage carefully and do the steps described there.

Read full topic
item.source: I2P is not working in whonix-workstation

item.title: I2P is not working in whonix-workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Tray:

what is 9.27?

i2p package version?

and do I need to change proxy settings in Tor browser ?

Changes to Tor Browser are documented on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/I2P
under 3. Install FoxyProxy:. That’s it.

Read full topic
item.source: I2P is not working in whonix-workstation

‘sudo systemctl status i2p’ timer showing network is activated 30 min ago. I still cant access i2p websites through tor browser. Time out error and server not found error.
